title: Delhi HC upholds Army officer’s termination for refusing to attend religious parade
content: The Delhi High Court upheld the 2017 termination of an Army officer who refused to participate in regimental religious parades due to his Christian faith. The court emphasized that the armed forces are united by their uniform, not divided by religion, and the officer's behavior was against the secular norms of the Army.

title: 'Planned systematic attack': B'desh starts trial of Sheikh Hasina over 2024 crackdown on protesters
content: Sheikh Hasina's trial commenced in Bangladesh, accusing her of orchestrating a violent crackdown on 2024 protests that resulted in numerous deaths. The prosecution presented evidence of a coordinated attack, while Hasina, in exile, dismissed the charges as politically motivated. Simultaneously, Bangladesh's Supreme Court lifted a ban on Jamaat-e-Islami, adding another layer of complexity to the nation's political landscape.

title: Flash floods, waterlogging hit Agartala, life disrupted; IMD issues heavy rainfall alert
content: Agartala grapples with severe flash floods following incessant monsoon rains, disrupting normal life and prompting the displacement of over 6000 residents. The Chief Minister is monitoring the situation, while the administration has opened relief camps. IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall, raising concerns about further flooding, landslides, and potential disruptions across Tripura.

title: 'Why did we have to wait for CDS to speak from Singapore?': Cong slams Centre over jets
content: Jairam Ramesh, a Congress MP, raised concerns regarding the government's handling of Operation Sindoor disclosures. He questioned why CDS General Anil Chauhan revealed key details abroad first. Ramesh felt the Defence Minister should have informed Parliament. He compared this to Vajpayee's transparency during the Kargil conflict.

title: 21 killed, 175 wounded during aid distribution in Gaza
content: A tragic incident unfolded in the Gaza Strip as at least 21 individuals lost their lives and 175 sustained injuries while seeking aid from an Israeli-backed foundation. Witnesses reported Israeli forces opened fire on crowds near the distribution site, though the Israeli military acknowledged only firing warning shots.

title: Who is Megha Vemuri, Indian-American student banned from MIT ceremony
content: Megha Vemuri, MIT's Class of 2025 president, was banned from her graduation after delivering a pro-Palestine speech criticizing the university's ties with Israel. MIT cited disruption of an official event as the reason, leading to online backlash and Vemuri deleting her LinkedIn profile. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions surrounding campus activism and free speech related to the Israel-Gaza conflict.

title: Punjab Kings' biggest challenge: How to survive 'possessed' Bumrah's 24 balls
content: Jasprit Bumrah rarely shows emotion on the pitch and seldom celebrates a wicket, but in the IPL 2025 Eliminator, he looked like a man possessed. He finished with 1/27 in four overs — below par by his standards — yet Washington Sundar’s wicket turned the tide in MI’s favour. In a world where bowlers get their due beyond talk shows and podcasts, Bumrah might well have pipped Rohit for the Player of the Match award.

title: 'Free the brave!': Dutch politician backs arrested influencer Sharmistha Panoli
content: Dutch politician Geert Wilders has voiced his support for Sharmishta Panoli, an Indian influencer arrested for allegedly making communal remarks in a social media video. Wilders condemned the arrest as a disgrace to freedom of speech, urging Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene.

title: Salesman slapped, thrashed with belt for charging Rs 10 extra on beer in Noida
content: In Greater Noida, a liquor salesman, Manish Kumar, alleges that excise inspector Chandra Shekhar assaulted him for overcharging customers. Kumar claims he was slapped, beaten with a belt, and detained at the excise office. His family protested after police refused to register a complaint.

title: Billionaire Harsh Goenka shares post on Adani vs Pakistan: Just one Indian company...
content: Harsh Goenka sparked discussion by comparing the Adani Group's economic strength to Pakistan's entire economy on Twitter. He highlighted Adani's superior market capitalization, renewable energy capacity, green hydrogen ambitions, and port operations. Goenka used analogies to emphasize the perceived mismatch, leading to supportive comments about India's economic dominance.

title: How Delhi's summer is changing: 3-fold rise in May rainfall in 75 years
content: Delhi recorded its wettest May since 1901, reflecting a sharp rise in rainfall over decades—tripling since 1951. Recent years saw an average of 95.7mm rain, yet temperatures remain unchanged. Experts link the trend to increased thunderstorms and moisture from global warming. Rising humidity heightens health risks, power demand, and infrastructure stress, signaling a significant climate shift.

title: Man taking pictures with friends falls into sea in Mumbai, dies
content: Tragedy struck Juhu Koliwada as Anil Arjun Rajput, 20, drowned near Juhu Jetty. He was reportedly taking pictures with friends when the incident occurred. The Mumbai Fire Brigade received the alert at 8:17 pm. Lifeguards rescued Rajput and rushed him to Cooper Hospital. Sadly, doctors pronounced him dead on arrival. The incident is under investigation.

title: WhatsApp will not work on these iPhones and Android smartphones from today
content: Starting June 1, 2025, WhatsApp will discontinue support for older iPhones lacking iOS 15.1 and Android devices below version 5.1. This update, delayed from May 5th, aims to enhance security and performance by leveraging newer OS features. Affected users are advised to upgrade their devices, explore alternative messaging apps, or back up their chats to avoid service disruptions.

title: 'Pak DGMO called but problem with hotline': All-party delegation on how truce was reached
content: An all-party delegation revealed that the India-Pakistan truce on May 10 was initiated by Pakistan, dismissing claims of third-party mediation. JDU MP Sanjay Kumar Jha stated that the Pakistani DGMO's call for a ceasefire faced hotline issues, leading to communication through their embassy in India.

title: Sikkim bridge washes away as Teesta River swells amid heavy rainfall
content: Heavy rainfall in North Sikkim has triggered landslides and caused the Teesta River to wash away a key section of the under-construction Sankalang Bridge, severing links to remote areas. A red alert is in place as rescue teams search for nine missing tourists after a vehicle plunged into the river. Multiple properties were damaged, and travel advisories have been issued.

title: ‘Secularism must be two-way street’: Kalyan slams student's arrest by WB Police
content: Pawan Kalyan has denounced the arrest of a Symbiosis law student for allegedly hurting religious sentiments through a viral video during ‘Operation Sindoor’. He criticized the silence surrounding alleged blasphemy by TMC leaders and MPs, accusing them of mocking Sanatana Dharma. The student was remanded to judicial custody, and Symbiosis International University suspended her, distancing itself from her comments.

title: Minor rape survivor waits for hours in ambulance outside Patna hospital
content: A minor rape survivor, referred to Patna Medical College Hospital (PMCH) from Muzaffarpur, faced a harrowing four-hour wait in an ambulance due to bed unavailability. This incident has exposed the dire state of Bihar's public health system.

title: India lost jets but changed tactics to hit Pakistan hard: CDS
content: CDS General Anil Chauhan acknowledged India's initial fighter jet losses during Operation Sindoor against terror hubs in Pakistan and PoK on May 7. He refuted Pakistan's claims of shooting down six IAF aircraft, including Rafales. India adapted its tactics, inflicting significant damage on Pakistani airbases deep inside the border before a ceasefire was established.

title: NEET UG 2025 answer key expected soon: Check steps to download & important details here
content: The NEET UG 2025 provisional answer key is expected to be released soon on the official NTA website, neet.nta.nic.in. Over 20 lakh candidates appeared for the May 4 exam. Once published, students can estimate scores and raise objections during a limited challenge window. Final results and All India Ranks will follow after expert review.

title: India's top-10 most valued firms add Rs 1 lakh crore in market value
content: Despite a muted equity market trend, four of the top 10 Indian companies, including LIC, SBI, HDFC Bank and Bharti Airtel, collectively added Rs 1,01,369.5 crore to their market valuation last week. However, six firms, such as Reliance and TCS, experienced a combined decrease of Rs 34,852.35 crore.

title: 'Dear mom & dad ... ': Tej Pratap pleads for love, blames ‘greedy people’ for rift with family
content: Following his expulsion from the RJD and estrangement from his father, Lalu Prasad Yadav, Tej Pratap Yadav has publicly appealed to his parents for their love and trust, blaming political conspiracies for his downfall. Lalu expelled Tej Pratap for allegedly violating moral values and harming the family's principles after a controversial social media post.

title: Watch: Imagine Dragons' Dan Reynolds kisses Palestinian flag on stage
content: Imagine Dragons' Dan Reynolds ignited controversy by kissing a Palestinian flag during a Milan concert, sparking accusations of supporting extremism and betraying pro-Israel fans. The act drew both outrage and support, highlighting the band's complicated history with the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, including a previous performance in Tel Aviv and waving a Ukrainian flag during the same concert.

title: Chirag Paswan to contest Bihar polls from general seat? What LJP said
content: Chirag Paswan's potential entry into Bihar's assembly elections gains traction as his party suggests he contest from a general seat, deviating from his past Lok Sabha campaigns in reserved constituencies. Arun Bharti, LJP (Ram Vilas) Bihar in-charge, emphasized that Paswan represents the aspirations of all Bihar, not just a specific community.

title: Valmik Thapar walked with tigers, now he rests
content: Valmik Thapar, a renowned conservationist, author, and documentarian, passed away at 73 after dedicating 50 years to tiger conservation in India. His encounter with Fateh Singh Rathore in Ranthambhore ignited a lifelong mission to protect tigers, leading to the establishment of the Ranthambhore Foundation and influencing national wildlife policy.

title: Mysterious space object sends signals to Earth every 44 mins, scientists baffled
content: Astronomers in Australia have detected a mysterious cosmic object, ASKAP J1832-0911, emitting radio and X-ray bursts every 44 minutes, an unprecedented occurrence. This long-period transient defies existing stellar remnant theories with its rhythmic pattern. The discovery, made using ASKAP and Chandra, may indicate a new class of celestial bodies, prompting further investigation into its origin and implications for space science.

title: Watch: Goa crow shows off football skills, internet wants to sign him up
content: A remarkable video from South Goa has captured the hearts of social media users, showcasing an extraordinary football match between a young boy and a crow. The bird skillfully uses its beak to pass the ball back and forth, creating an adorable and captivating display of interspecies teamwork.

title: Russia an 'immediate' threat, China a 'sophisticated' one: UK defence review warns
content: The UK's defence review identifies Russia as an immediate threat and China as a persistent challenge, drawing lessons from the Ukraine war. Britain faces a new era of warfare with emerging technologies.

title: Trump crackdown on student visas: Here’s what Indians are doing
content: Amidst stricter student visa regulations and political uncertainties in the US, Indian students and their families are increasingly exploring the EB-5 visa option for permanent residency. Applications from F-1 visa holders have surged, driven by concerns over potential disruptions to their academic pursuits and future prospects.

title: Watch: Guwahati submerged as heavy rain causes severe waterlogging
content: Guwahati experienced severe waterlogging due to incessant rainfall, leading to rescue operations by various agencies. The city recorded its highest-ever May rainfall, intensifying the impact of a depression over Bangladesh and Meghalaya. Tragically, several fatalities were reported across northeastern states, including Assam, due to floods and landslides, prompting ongoing evacuation and relief efforts.

title: Doctors treat patients under mobile flashlights after power outage in Telangana hospital
content: Following a viral video showing patients treated under mobile phone lights during a power outage, the in-charge superintendent of Zaheerabad area hospital, V Sridhar Kumar, has been suspended. An inquiry revealed a delay in activating the backup generator, causing disruption in emergency services.

title: Watch: Chairs fly as wedding guests brawl over cooler in Jhansi
content: A wedding celebration in Jhansi descended into chaos when a dispute over a cooler ignited a violent clash between the bride's and groom's families. The argument began when guests from the groom's side sat in front of a cooler meant for the wedding couple, leading to objections from the bride's family.

title: Covid in US: Kids now 'may receive' COVID-19 vaccines
content: A new Covid-19 strain, NB.1.8.1, is under scrutiny as Washington state reports its first case. Simultaneously, the CDC has updated its vaccine guidance, now allowing, but not mandating, Covid-19 vaccines for healthy children based on clinical judgment. This shift follows a directive from Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., raising concerns among health officials about evidence-based decision-making.

title: Michelle Obama says 'creating life is the least' a woman's body does, faces heat
content: Michelle Obama's recent remarks on her podcast, stating that creating life is "the least" of what a woman's reproductive system does, have sparked controversy. She emphasised the broader importance of women's reproductive health beyond just procreation, criticising the lack of medical research and political decision-making on the issue. Conservative figures and social media users have strongly condemned her comments.

title: 32 dead as floods, landslides devastate northeast in early monsoon season
content: Heavy rains triggered by a depression over Bangladesh and Meghalaya have caused widespread devastation across five northeastern states, resulting in at least 32 deaths due to landslides and floods. Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Mizoram, and Arunachal Pradesh are the most affected, with houses collapsing, villages inundated, and transportation disrupted.

title: 'He is a Sinwar too': Israel military claims Hamas chief killed in May 13 strike
content: An Israeli airstrike on May 13 targeted and killed Muhammad Sinwar, a senior Hamas figure, while he was operating in a tunnel beneath the European Hospital in Khan Younis. The strike also eliminated Muhammad Shabana and Mahdi Quara, commanders within Hamas's ranks. When Yahya Sinwar was killed in combat in October 2024, Muhammad Sinwar became the leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip.

title: IPL 2025 Qualifier 2: Punjab Kings likely to get Yuzvendra Chahal boost
content: Punjab Kings bowler Yuzvendra Chahal, who is nursing a wrist injury, and Mumbai Indians' seamer Deepak Chahar, who didn't play the Eliminator against Gujarat Titans due to a hamstring niggle, are likely to play for their respective teams in Qualifier 2 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

title: Kolkata woman pushed off moving bus after protesting sexual harassment
content: In Kolkata, a 22-year-old woman was allegedly pushed off a moving bus in Sinthee More after confronting her molester. Md Saif, 21, was arrested by Cossipore Police and charged under multiple sections of the BNS. The incident occurred on a bus from Sealdah, where Saif allegedly sexually harassed the woman.

title: 7 killed, 30 injured as passenger train derails after bridge collapse in Russia
content: A passenger train derailed in Russia's Bryansk region after a bridge collapsed, resulting in at least seven fatalities and 30 injuries. Russian authorities attribute the incident to "illegal interference," citing damage to the bridge above the railway line. The collapse sent debris onto the tracks, impacting the oncoming train, with emergency services responding to the scene.

title: 'I am not taking drugs!': Musk refutes claims of drug abuse during 2024 campaign trail
content: Elon Musk refuted claims of extensive drug use, including ketamine, during the 2024 Presidential campaign, labeling a New York Times report as false. He admitted to a past prescription for ketamine to combat mental health issues but stated he hasn't used it recently. The report alleged Musk's drug use led to health problems and cited erratic behavior.

title: 'Unbearable': Why Nasser, Atherton don't want RCB to win IPL 2025
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru, under Rajat Patidar's leadership, have reached the IPL 2025 final, defeating Punjab Kings. Dinesh Karthik's role as batting coach is drawing attention, with predictions of exuberant celebrations if RCB win their first title. Karthik's coaching has already shown positive results, and he expresses a strong connection to the team and a desire to contribute to their success.

title: He robbed truck driver in Bengaluru, but didn’t know his punches killed victim
content: Bengaluru police solved the mystery of Gangadharaiah's death, initially deemed unnatural. An autopsy revealed fractured ribs, leading to a murder investigation. The break came when the victim's stolen mobile phone was activated in Salem, Tamil Nadu. Police traced it to Naresh Kumar Raja, a wanted criminal, who confessed to attacking and robbing Gangadharaiah, resulting in his death.

title: Pakistan violated Indus Water Treaty through terror: India
content: India has accused Pakistan of violating the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) due to persistent cross-border terrorism. At a conference in Tajikistan, Kirti Vardhan Singh condemned Pakistan's attempt to misuse the forum by raising IWT issues. Singh highlighted the need to reassess the treaty due to changed circumstances like technological advancements and climate change.

title: After Gill, Pandya also shuts down rumours of rift between the two
content: Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya have dismissed rumours of a rift following Gujarat Titans' IPL 2025 elimination, addressing speculation fuelled by on-field interactions and Pandya's move to Mumbai Indians. Both players affirmed their camaraderie on social media after Mumbai Indians' victory in the Eliminator match. Mumbai Indians will play IPL Qualifier 2 against Punjab Kings today.

title: 73 casualties recorded during 1st month of Char Dham yatra
content: The Char Dham yatra has seen 65 pilgrim deaths due to health issues, primarily cardiac-related, and eight fatalities from accidents. Kedarnath reported the highest number of deaths, followed by Badrinath, Yamunotri, and Gangotri. Health screenings identified thousands of pilgrims with comorbidities, with many receiving counseling or medical referrals due to the challenges posed by high altitudes and extreme weather conditions.

title: Spicejet fliers forced to sit in aircraft for 3 hours in Delhi
content: SpiceJet's Delhi-Pune flight SG-477, carrying approximately 150 passengers, reached its destination nearly four hours late on Friday. The flight, initially scheduled for a 3:25 pm departure, faced delays due to a last-minute technical issue. Passengers were kept waiting inside the aircraft for around three hours, causing frustration.

title: Scolding does not amount to provoking someone to take own life: Supreme Court
content: A Bench of Justices Ahsanuddin Amanullah and Prashant Kumar Mishra stated that no ordinary person could have imagined that a scolding would result in such a tragedy.

title: Abbas Ansari disqualified from U.P. Assembly after conviction in hate speech case
content: Abbas Ansari, the Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) MLA, was sentenced to two years imprisonment in a 2022 hate speech case by a special MP-MLA court on Saturday.

title: AIADMK names its candidates for Rajya Sabha poll; to allot seat for DMDK in 2026 RS election
content: AIADMK names candidates for Rajya Sabha elections in Tamil Nadu, with DMDK alliance and polling scheduled for June 19

title: Over 99.76 % of SSC answer scripts marked accurately, asserts Andhra Pradesh Directorate of Government Examinations
content: Out of the corrected cases, the statement said 8,863 scripts had minor changes of marks between 1 and 5 only, and 3,119 scripts had changes of more than 5 marks

title: Five arrested over gangrape of minor near Belagavi
content: The victim’s parents approached the police two days ago, after she complained. A team has been formed to track and apprehend the accused. Investigations are on

title: New-to-science ‘urban’ frog named after Shillong
content: Scientists of the Zoological Survey of India and local collaborators record the cryptic, cascade-dwelling amphibian from the Meghalaya capital

title: Ports department proposes to build five groynes at Uchhila-Batpady to arrest sea erosion
content: With the link road connecting Batpady end-point at Kerala border almost destroyed, the department also proposes to rebuild the road

title: Amit Shah inaugurates new building of Central Forensic Science Laboratory near Kolkata
content: Amit Shah said the inauguration marks a significant milestone in the Centre’s long-standing efforts to build a secure, transparent and evidence-driven criminal justice system

title: Zee Tamil’s Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Seniors 5 returns in style; Vijay TV’s Startup Singam gears up for Season 2
content: Zee Tamil’s ‘Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Seniors Season 5’ and Vijay TV’s ‘Startup Singam Season 2’ bring musical talent and entrepreneurial stories

title: Northeastern states floods | 3,802 people affected, 883 houses damaged as heavy rain batters Manipur
content: Heavy rain in Manipur causes floods and landslides, affecting 3,802 people and damaging 883 houses in 48 hours; 12 landslides occurred across the State

title: Shashi Tharoor-led all-party delegation reaches Brazil to convey India's resolute stance in fight against terrorism
content: During the visit, the delegation will engage with senior Brazilian leaders and Parliamentarians, including Celso Amorim, Head Adviser to the President, Maria Laura da Rocha, Secretary General of Foreign Affairs, Senator Nelson Trad

title: BJP national leadership fields KC(J) leader as the party’s candidate in the Nilambur Assembly by-election
content: Mohan George is a member of the predominantly settler-farmer Christian community, a significant electoral bloc in the Nilambur Assembly constituency

title: Greedy people playing politics with me: Tej Pratap Yadav on ouster from RJD, family
content: Mr. Prasad had on May 25 expelled his elder son Mr. Yadav from the party and snapped all family ties with him, stating that his actions were "irresponsible" and not in accordance with public conduct

title: 81 'anti-nationals' arrested in Assam after Pahalgam terror attack
content: 81 anti-nationals arrested in Assam for sympathising with Pakistan after Pahalgam terror attack, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma confirms

title: Northeast floods, landslides leaves 30 dead since May 29 | LIVE
content: Heavy rain continues to batter Assam, disrupting train services, road transport; Teesta River’s water level significantly rises in Sikkim

title: News in Frames | Daring 17: The first women who crossed NDA portals
content: The graduation ceremony for the 148th course of National Defence Academy marks a watershed moment for Indian armed forces with the first batch of women passing out from the academy

title: Palghar murder accused on run for 24 years arrested from U.P.
content: On January 14, 2001, a man, identified as Moharram Ali Mohammad Ibrahim Ali (46), was stabbed in the stomach with a sharp weapon in Virar area and he later succumbed to his injuries

title: 71 killed due to excessive pre-monsoon rains in Karnataka since April
content: The State normally receives 74 mm of rainfall in May, but the actual rainfall was 219 mm, which is 197% higher than the average normal rainfall

title: Nearly 1,500 tourists stranded in north Sikkim as rains continue, search for missing 8 suspended
content: Mangan's SP Sonam Detchu Bhutia said 115 tourists are stranded in Lachen and 1,350 tourists in Lachung

title: Instagram influencer Sharmishta Panoli arrested for communal post, sent to 14 days judicial custody
content: According to the Kolkata Police, several attempts were made to serve legal notices to Ms. Panoli and her family, but the attempts were unsuccessful because Ms. Panoli and her family absconded

title: Union Minister Somanna inspects redevelopment works at Bidar railway station
content: The project, which is being implemented at an estimated cost of ₹24.35 crore, aims to transform the station with modern amenities and improved infrastructure

title: Naidu has corrupted all systems in A.P., alleges Sajjala
content: Cases are being filed against the opposition leaders without any evidence, alleges Ramakrishna Reddy

title: Ex-Maoist found dead in Jharkhand jail
content: Chota Shyamlal Dehri, 30, who surrendered in 2020 and faced eight cases, was found hanging in his cell at Hazaribag, officials said

title: Awareness programmes mark ‘World No Tobacco Day’
content: The Collector administered a pledge against using tobacco to participants and asked the youth to enlighten the people on the ill-effects of using tobacco products

title: TTD official warns against circulating ‘misleading’ video clips on social media
content: The warning comes after a video clip about devotees waiting in darshan queue lines allegedly growing restive went viral on social media

title: Multi-disciplinary approach crucial for students to land jobs: academics at a webinar
content: Prof. A. Vinay Kumar of SRMIST and Prof. A. Joseph Dorairaj advised students to develop cognitive abilities and problem-solving skills rather than solely chasing high grades

title: Tardy progress of Budameru works causes concern
content: Officials say that the contractor could not mobilise sufficient machinery and workforce in time; WRD Minister asks officials to issue notice to contracting agency

title: TDP used Mahanadu to target YSRCP leaders, alleges MLC Botcha Satyanarayana
content: Satyanarayana calls Mahanadu event a drama, says the event aimed at diverting attention from the ‘failures of the NDA government’

title: SIT questions accused in liquor scam for second day
content: The investigating officers took the accused into custody from the Vijayawada jail and and questioned them for the second day

title: TTD initiates trial of anti-drone surveillance system at Tirumala
content: The aim is to enhance aerial security and prevent unauthorised drone activity in the airspace of the temple town

title: 89% schools and 87% colleges declared tobacco-free: DPH
content: Director of Public Health said that Tamil Nadu has implemented comprehensive interventions focussed on enforcement, awareness, capacity building, cessation services and safeguarding institutions from tobacco exposure

title: Ride easy: reimagining Chennai’s future rail networks
content: For nearly three decades, very few improvements were made to the primary urban-suburban rail network of Chennai. Although the MRTS and Metro Rail were introduced, the Metro has become more popular due to its superior services. Now, it seems that for the first time, there appears to be a focused effort to improve rail services in Chennai. Along with enhancements to the Metro, will the city have an enviable rail service in a decade?

title: How do military standoffs affect aviation? | Explained
content: What are the situations in which countries can close their airspace? Are only military planes banned? What happens to civilian flights? After Operation Sindoor, are Indian planes now being allowed in Pakistan and vice-versa?

title: Punjab Police report disrupted drug supply chain, prices surge amid ongoing anti-drug drive
content: DGP Gaurav Yadav announces intensified crackdown with fresh action plans, while Congress challenges AAP’s ‘drug-free Punjab’ deadline

title: Why is the RBI changing gold loan rules? | Explained
content: What are the draft proposals? What has the Ministry of Finance clarified? What will be the impact on borrowers?

title: BJP MLAs, farmers, seers stage protest opposing Hemavathi Express Link Canal Project in Tumakuru
content: Tumakuru MP and Union Minister of State for Jal Shakti V Somanna writes to CM opposing the project to supply water to from Tumakuru to Bengaluru South district

title: Amid opposition, GCC advances Solid Waste Processing Facility project at Kodungaiyur
content: The civic body has initiated the process to appoint an independent engineer (IE) to supervise the implementation of the project

title: Nurse booked for accidentally chopping off tip of newborn’s thumb at Vellore hospital
content: The nurse was removing paediatric venflon from the baby’s hand when she mistakenly cut off the tip of its right thumb; the baby was then taken to the Government Stanley Hospital in Chennai where doctors performed surgery; Vellore Collector has ordered an inquiry into the incident

title: Work on subway near Green Circle in Vellore on fast track
content: The new underpass will end a detour of at least one km by motorists and walkers, say officials; the facility will help decongest service lanes on both sides of the Chennai-Bengaluru Highway

title: Telangana CM joins Miss World crowning ceremony
content: During the announcement of the winner, Chief Minister Revanth Reddy was invited on stage to be part of the crowning ceremony

title: After a soaking May, IMD predicts slowdown in rain activity for a week
content: With no significant weather system over the Bay of Bengal, Chennai too may begin to experience a mild increase in maximum temperature from Sunday

title: Anbumani says he will steer PMK, calls his father ‘family deity’
content: Speaking to the office-bearers from PMK strongholds such as Dharmapuri, Salem, Erode, Namakkal and Kallakurichi districts, Dr. Anbumani urged them to undertake a membership drive in the next three weeks and said that that he would soon take out a yatra across Tamil Nadu

title: Large crowd gathers to greet Chief Minister Stalin at roadshow in Madurai
content: He interacts with supporters during 20-km event, unveils life-size bronze statue of former Madurai Mayor S. Muthu; he will address the DMK’s general council meeting at Uthangudi today

title: Rajeev Krishna appointed acting DGP of Uttar Pradesh
content: Becomes fifth consecutive IPS officer to hold the post in an officiating capacity; SP chief Akhilesh Yadav questions move

title: KPTCL unveils GIS-based app to monitor underground cable works in real-time
content: According to officials, it is designed primarily for internal use, the Map View application showcases live updates of ongoing underground cable laying activities across Karnataka.

title: ‘Serious errors’ in SSC evaluation a blot on the government, say student organisations
content: Blaming the government for its haste in releasing the results early, they demand that action against teachers be dropped and re-evaluation fee collected from students refunded

title: Delivery agents continue to brave Bengaluru’s monsoon without safety nets
content: Most agents still use personal scooters or rent electric vehicles which are unsafe, especially on flooded roads

title: Karnataka: State police chief asks personnel to refrain from random vehicle checks
content: Guidelines come in the wake of two recent incidents in Mandya and Davangere where random checks led to deaths

title: Bamboo and kendu power to the people
content: Those living in the forest villages of Odisha’s Kalahandi district, mostly tribal, are coming together to assert their rights over the forest provided to them by law, but often not claimed and sometimes denied. Satyasundar Barik finds that they are directly negotiating with traders to create a source of income without government go-betweens

title: KSRTC launches weekend package tour to Srirangapatna, Melukote from Bengaluru
content: The service began on May 31, and will be operational every Saturday and Sunday, according to officials.

title: No one trusts Bandi Sanjay’s comments on Congress: TPCC leader
content: Mr. Dayakar questioned the BJP’s credibility, pointing out that the party has failed to address the people’s concerns and has instead resorted to spreading false propaganda

title: Karnataka tightens COTPA rules; penalty for violations, legal age for purchasing tobacco products raised
content: The amended Act — the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products (Prohibition of Advertisement and Regulation of Trade and Commerce, Production, Supply and Distribution) (Karnataka Amendment) Act, 2024 — was published in the Karnataka Gazette on May 30

title: India engages U.S. in plans to ‘grey list’ Pakistan at FATF session
content: Foreign Secretary Misri concludes three-day visit, discusses trade and defence deals with his counterparts

title: As deaths in Karnataka touch four, Health Dept. issues advisory on COVID-19 surveillance, safety
content: An 84-year-old in Bengaluru, a 70-year-old in Belagavi, and a 63-year-old in Mysuru, who also had several comorbid conditions and developed COVID, succumbed to the disease on May 17, 26, and 25 respectively.

title: Thailand’s Opal Suchata Chuangsri crowned Miss World 2025 in a dazzling grand finale in Hyderabad
content: The month-long celebration in Telangana featured historical tours, cultural showcases and a global platform for advocacy and empowerment

title: Government employees should not avail of Ladkhi Bahin scheme: Maharashtra Revenue Minister
content: The government would recover the money in such instances, and some departments had already commenced inquiries, Chandrashekhar Bawankule said

title: Hyderabad to adopt ‘land pooling’ and Local Area Development Planning to revolutionise HMDA functioning
content: LADP envisions intensive planning inside each grid, consisting of 250 to 300 acres of land, leading to more organised development; it will also help planners to earmark spaces for public utilities, parks, schools and hospitals, besides providing pedestrian infrastructure, HMDA Commissioner said

title: Centre notifies new age-based film certification categories under U/A rating
content: CBFC to certify films with ‘U/A 7+’, ‘U/A 13+’, and ‘U/A 16+’ tags to promote age-appropriate viewing

title: Doping charge: Karnataka High Court sets aside four-year ban imposed on national level basketball player Shashank Rai
content: Court terms actions of anti-doping agencies ‘a classic illustration of breach of sample integrity’ and lacking in fair hearing

title: Indian Coast Guard evacuates heart attack-stricken captain from foreign vessel at sea
content: The Indian Coast Guard said it coordinated a “life saving medical evacuation operation” and evacuated a heart attack-stricken captain Bahamas flagged vessel

title: Nodal officers to monitor CSR-funded public schools; ‘diversion’ of corporate funds flagged
content: Some corporates are allocating CSR funds to NGOs in other States and taking back 50% of it in cash, says Shivakumar

title: Takeaways: Why the Knicks got pummeled by the Pacers in Game 6
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: 'Special' Pacers top Knicks, punch Finals ticket
content: Pascal Siakam earned Eastern Conference MVP honors after leading the Pacers to a Game 6 victory over the Knicks to set up a date with OKC in the Finals.

title: Brunson: 'Utmost confidence' Knicks' core can win
content: Despite Saturday's season-ending loss, Jalen Brunson said there isn't "an ounce of any type of doubt" that the Knicks' core can take the next step toward a title.

title: PSG rout Inter in record UCL final win for 1st title
content: Paris Saint-Germain won their first Champions League title with a 5-0 demolition of Inter Milan -- the biggest winning margin in the final of the competition.

title: Trans athlete wins 2 titles at Calif. track champ.
content: Transgender athlete AB Hernandez took home gold in the girls' high jump and the triple jump at the California high school track and field championship Saturday.

title: Thunder -750 favorites in NBA Finals over Pacers
content: Oklahoma City is one of the biggest betting favorites in an NBA Finals across the past 20 seasons, with the West champion Thunder opening as -750 favorites over the Pacers at ESPN BET on Saturday night, and the return price for Indiana was set at +525.

title: LAFC secures last CWC spot in dramatic fashion
content: Denis Bouanga scored a goal in the 115th minute to secure a 2-1 victory for Los Angeles FC over Club America in the Club World Cup play-in match at BMO Stadium on Saturday night.

title: Nats jump on D-backs in 10-run, 30-minute 1st
content: The Nationals' first 11 batters reached base as they scored nine runs before the D-backs got an out during a 10-run first inning Saturday night. Washington won 11-7.

title: Flawless Scheffler surges into lead at Memorial
content: Scottie Scheffler was at his best on a tough day at Muirfield Village, opening with 13 straight pars and then pouring it on at the end for a 4-under 68 that gave him a one-shot lead Saturday over Ben Griffin at the Memorial.

title: 🏈 CFP format debate: What we've learned
content: The debate about the future format of the CFP is raging. Particularly, how it hurts or helps the biggest leagues.

title: PSG win first Champions League by utterly humiliating Inter Milan
content: Led by 19-year-old Désiré Doué, a young PSG side embarrassed an experienced Inter Milan in the UEFA Champions League final.

title: NBA Finals first look: 7 things to know ahead of Pacers-Thunder
content: What are the most important matchups? What history is at stake? Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton take an early look at Thunder-Pacers.

title: NBA should be terrified of this OKC team
content: The Thunder have followed in the footsteps of the 2014-15 Warriors this season. Is this a future dynasty?

title: How Freddie Freeman's World Series grand slam changed him -- and Dodgers fans -- forever
content: There are bobbleheads, T-shirts, tattoos -- and even one fan, according to Freeman, who said he hadn't touched a drink since.

title: Emma Hayes has found her USWNT 'Triple Espresso' alternatives
content: Michelle Cooper and Alyssa Thompson were electric on Saturday, offering Emma Hayes even more options as she plots the USWNT's path to 2027 World Cup glory.

title: The Americans still playing at the 2025 French Open
content: American star Coco Gauff and newcomer Hailey Baptiste are still in the draw at the French Open -- but who else is? We break it down.

title: Is Shedeur Sanders set up to win QB battle in Browns' new-look offense?
content: The Browns have a lot of new faces on offense, including at coordinator and under center, as they reshape the unit.

title: Verstappen on battling McLarens: My time to shine
content: Max Verstappen joked that he will try to put on a show for the cameras in Turn 1 against the dominant McLarens.

title: Luis Enrique honors late daughter after UCL final
content: Paris Saint-Germain manager Luis Enrique honoured his late daughter, Xana, by planting the French club's flag on the pitch after winning the Champions League final.

title: Brilliant Messi helps Miami win big before CWC
content: Lionel Messi scored for the fifth time in three Major League Soccer matches to help Inter Miami rout the Columbus Crew 5-1 on Saturday night.

title: 'Momma Em' helps LaBonta make USWNT history
content: Lo'eau LaBonta became the oldest player to debut in the USWNT's history on Saturday when she appeared during the 3-0 win over China.

title: Mbappé, Neymar salute PSG on UCL title win
content: Kylian Mbappé congratulated Paris Saint-Germain after his former club won their first Champions League title on Saturday.

title: Victorious PSG eye 'cherry on the cake' at CWC
content: Luis Enrique said Paris Saint-Germain want to "continue to conquer" by making the FIFA Club World Cup the "cherry on the cake" after winning their Champions League title.

title: Inzaghi won't rule out Inter exit after final loss
content: Simone Inzaghi cast doubt on his future as Inter Milan coach following his team's 5-0 Champions League final defeat against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Antony says farewell to Betis: 'Felt like home'

title: Russia Says "Explosions" Caused 2 Deadly Bridge Collapses in 24 Hours
content: Two bridges have collapsed overnight in different parts of Russian regions bordering Ukraine, derailing trains and killing at least seven people.

title: "Blown Away": Former Danish Ambassador On Adani Group's Khavda Renewable Energy Park
content: Freddy Svane visited Adani Group's renewable energy park in Khavda - the world's largest - in November last year, along with ambassadors from the European Union (EU), Belgium, and Germany.

title: Mukhtar Ansari's MLA Son Removed From UP Assembly Over Hate Speech Conviction
content: Abbas Ansari, the Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP) MLA, was sentenced to two years imprisonment in a 2022 hate speech case by a special MP-MLA court on Saturday.

title: Palghar Murder Accused, On The Run For 24 Years, Arrested In UP
content: On January 14, 2001, a man, identified as Moharram Ali Mohammad Ibrahim Ali (46), was stabbed in the stomach with a sharp weapon in Virar area and he later succumbed to his injuries.

title: Classical Language Day, No Cap On Jewel Loans: Resolutions Passed At DMK Meet
content: The meeting also heaped praise on DMK President and Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin for his successive electoral victories.

title: 26 Killed, 80 Wounded As Israeli Tanks Open Fire Near Aid Centre In Gaza
content: At least 26 Palestinians were killed and over 80 others were injured after Israeli forces opened fire near a US-backed aid distribution site in southern Gaza's Rafah area.

title: This Is The Word That Won 13-Year-Old Faizan Zaki The US Spelling Bee
content: Faizan Zaki, who was last year's runner-up, sealed his victory on May 29 by confidently spelling the challenging word without hesitation, then celebrated by pumping his fists and collapsing on stage as confetti fell.

title: Sheikh Hasina's Big Trial Begins, Charged With Crimes Against Humanity

title: Who Is Sharmishta Panoli, What Did She Say That Landed Her In Jail

title: Scolding Does Not Amount To Provoking Someone To Take Own Life: Top Court
content: A bench of Justices Ahsanuddin Amanullah and Prashant Kumar Mishra stated that no ordinary person could have imagined that a scolding would result in such a tragedy.

title: Mumbai Man Falls Into Sea While Talking Photos With Friends, Dies
content: A 20-year-old man has died after falling into the sea in Mumbai while apparently taking photographs with his friends, a civic official said.

title: "Wasn't Near France": Elon Musk Snubs French President On Black Eye Question
content: A viral video showed French President Emmanuel Macron getting his face seemingly shoved aside by his wife, Brigitte, while deboarding a plane in Vietnam.

title: "When We Get Back...": Shashi Tharoor On Congress Colleagues' Swipes At Him

title: Revenue Service Officer Arrested For Demanding Rs 45 Lakh Bribe In Delhi
content: The CBI registered a case on Saturday on allegations that the accused public servant demanded illegal gratification of Rs 45 lakh from the complainant.

title: Bangladesh Top Court Restores Banned Jamaat-e-Islami's Party Registration
content: Bangladesh on Sunday restored the registration of the largest Islamist party, allowing it to take part in elections, more than a decade after it was removed under the now-overthrown government.

title: Harvard President's Trump Dig Gets Standing Ovation During Graduation Event
content: Harvard University's Class of 2025 graduated on Thursday amid a deepening standoff between the university and the Trump administration over foreign student admissions.
